Forests would be overrun with giant squirrels, and their acorn stashes would be off-limits to smaller creatures.
The Great Barrier Reef would become a coral kingdom, with giant sea anemones and brain corals ruling the seas.
The Serengeti would transform into a savannah of giant wildebeests, with predators struggling to keep up with their massive prey.
The Amazon rainforest would become a jungle of giant trees, with vines as thick as a man's thigh and flowers the size of dinner plates.
The Grand Canyon would be home to giant condors, with wingspans of over 20 feet, soaring overhead and ruling the skies.
